sourceMeaningMnemonic:
A <radical>dirt</radical> <radical>alligator</radical> lives in the <kanji>earth</kanji>, not the water. They can swim through the earth itself! Which is pretty scary.

You can think of this word as <kanji>ground</kanji> too, because that's kind of what earth is made of.
meaningInfo: Imagine seeing the earth moving as a dirt alligator rises out from the ground. You should run.
readingMnemonic: The only way to keep this dirt alligator from dragging you under the <kanji>earth</kanji> and eating you is to feed it <reading>chee</reading>se (<ja>ち</ja>). That way it won't lead you to a horrific death under the earth by dragging you under and spinning you around until you eat dirt (literally).
readingInfo: If you ever see someone throwing cheese on the ground, now you know why. They aren't crazy, they're saving us humans from what's lurking under the earth.
